docs.lead_paragraph: At the meeting of the Rapid Transit Commission held yesterday Edward M. Shepard, long an associate counsel for that body, resigned to become general counsel for several railroad corporations, while ex-Corporation Counsel George L. Rives was named as his successor, at an annual salary of $10,000.

headline.main: E.M. SHEPARD RESIGNS AS TRANSIT COUNSEL; Will Accept Retainer from the Pennsylvania Railroad. Commission Chooses George L. Rives as His Successor -- Plans for Cars on Williamsburg Bridge.

docs.abstract: Schleiger, Annie, and Hilda Jacobs run down by James Dobbins
